title: Animal Treatment Cage handed over to Pandulagama
description: An Adjustable Animal Treatment Cage was successfully handed over to the DWC Health Management Division at Pandulagama.
author: Wild Sri Lanka Team
content: An Adjustable Animal Treatment Cage was successfully handed over to the DWC Health Management Division at Pandulagama, Anuradapura (as the 1st Phase of the “WPL 2023” project). We express our heartfelt thanks to all those who helped us. Another medical cage is being completed as the second phase, and more details are to be expected in a few days. Special Credits: Inaire (Pvt) Ltd

title: Animal Treatment Cage handed over to Galvezland National Park
description: Join our expert photographers for an immersive 5-day workshop in the heart of Sri Lanka's wilderness. Learn advanced techniques for capturing wildlife in their natural habitat.
author: Wild Sri Lanka Team
content: The second adjustable animal treatment cage was successfully handed over to Galvezland National Park, Nuwara Eliya (as the second phase of the “WPL 2023” project). We express our heartfelt thanks to all those who helped us. Special credits: Inaire (Pvt) Ltd

title: Sense the Lens Photography Workshop
description: Sense the Lens Photography Workshop was successfully concluded by our fellow Admin Isuru Praveen Ranasinghe
author: Wild Sri Lanka Team
content: Sense the Lens Photography Workshop was successfully concluded by our fellow Admin Isuru Praveen Ranasinghe at the D.S Senanayake College Mini Auditorium on August 10, 2023.  We are honored to share our knowledge with the younger generation and hope that this will improve your photography skills to new heights. Special thanks to The Principal of D.S Senanayake Collage, WSL Admin Mr. Isuru Praveen, Members Of D.S OBA Wildlife & Environment Conservation Club, Mr. Raveendra Siriwardene, Mr.Saman Halloluwa, Dakshina Palihawadana Teachers in Charge and all members of D.S Photographic Society

content: Modern Wildlife Photography by Mr.Lakshitha Karunarathna, Knowledge Sharing Sessions along with WIld Srilanka Photographer of the Year 2022 (WSLPOTY 2022) at JDA Perera Gallery.

title: Wildlife Conservation and Effects of Climate Change in the South Asia Region
description: Wildlife Conservation and Effects of Climate Change in the South Asia Region by Parvish Pandya
author: Wild Sri Lanka Team
content: The lecture on Wildlife Conservation and Effects of Climate Change in the South Asia Region by Parvish Pandya, Consultant Director, Science and Conservation at Sanctuary Nature Foundation, was organized by the Wild Sri Lanka group on September 17, 2019.
